comments.body: Do I really have to be a codeowner? I very much like to be able to differentiate between people requesting my review explicitly which I get as email notifications and just codeowner notifications which I mostly get simply by looking at all PRs.
If I do have to be a codeowner I probably should be a codeowner here as well given that Iâ€™ve written significant parts of `daml-helper` and the integration tests.
@aherrmann-da should probably also be a code owner on this if we want to be accurate.
Same here.

```suggestion
/daml-assistant/    @associahedron @hurryabit @cocreature
```

While @associahedron is certainly the ultimate head of DAML assistant, you probably wanted to add me.
Moved to https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/pull/4306

I think you're supposed to keep `@digital-asset/empty` so those who want to be notified of everything can be members of the empty group. (!!)

```suggestion
/ci/                @digital-asset/empty @garyverhaegen-da
```

Same goes for the other lines.

That was not the intention, just meant as a placeholder, but we can set something like that up. I don't think we should use CODEOWNERS for notifications though, since it conflates two separate concerns.
Ok, approving then.
(But note that there are lines with `@digital-asset/empty @gerolf-da` for instance.)

Yep, that's fair. I expect to go through this in a couple of weeks or so and tidy it up after people have had a chance to add themselves as they prefer (and I would then remove the team from the org as well).

AFAIK, `CODEOWNERS` are the only way in GitHub to tailor what notifications you get. Thus, I'd be very much in favour if nobody removed the `@digitial-asset/empty` entries but just adds themselves to the list. We should probably rename the group into `@digital-asset/default` or something similar.
perhaps `@digital-asset/all-notifications`
If you want all notifications you can just subscribe to the repo without code owners. That's what I've done and it works well. As a result, I think eliminating empty is probably fine.
@cbaatz We should leave an instruction to never remove the `empty` group from anything. Then people can add themselves to it, if they want to be notified about everything.
but then rather rename it to `all-notifications` or something in that spirit.

diffHunk:
@@ -3,73 +3,73 @@
 
 # Only files explicitly mentioned are guarded by code owners (no * rule).
 
-*           @digital-asset/daml
+*           @digital-asset/empty

comments.body: @cbaatz-da: could you add `@digital-asset/ledger` here?
Done.

diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+# https://help.github.com/articles/about-codeowners/
+# Note that GitHub teams must have WRITE access to the repository.
+
+# Default owners for everything in the repo unless a later match takes
+# precedence.
+*           @digital-asset/daml-owners
+CODEOWNERS  @digital-asset/daml-owners # Only owners can change this file
+
+VERSION     @digital-asset/daml-approvers # Any approver can approve a release
+
+# Build / CI / environment
+/3rdparty/          @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/bazel_tools/       @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/build-scripts/     @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/ci/                @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/dev-env/           @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/hazel/             @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/nix/               @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/infra/             @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/pipeline/          @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/rules_daml/        @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/replacements/      @digital-asset/infrastructure
+BAZEL-JVM.md        @digital-asset/infrastructure
+BAZEL-haskell.md    @digital-asset/infrastructure
+BAZEL.md            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+BUILD               @digital-asset/infrastructure
+WORKSPACE           @digital-asset/infrastructure
+azure-pipelines.yml @digital-asset/infrastructure
+build.Jenkinsfile   @digital-asset/infrastructure
+build.ps1           @digital-asset/infrastructure
+build.sh            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+deps.bzl            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+dotfiles            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+
+# Language
+/compiler/          @digital-asset/language
+/daml-foundations/  @digital-asset/language
+/libs-haskell/      @digital-asset/language
+/ghc-lib/           @digital-asset/language
+
+# SDK
+/release/           @digital-asset/language @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/sdk/               @digital-asset/language
+/da-assistant/      @digital-asset/language
+/daml-assistant/    @digital-asset/language
+
+# Runtime
+/daml-lf/           @digital-asset/daml-lf
+/ledger/            @digital-asset/ledger
+/ledger-api/        @digital-asset/ledger
+
+# Ecosystems
+/language-support/          @digital-asset/java @digital-asset/scala @digital-asset/js
+/language-support/java/     @digital-asset/java
+/language-support/js/       @digital-asset/js
+/language-support/scala/    @digital-asset/scala
+/scala-protoc-plugins/      @digital-asset/scala

comments.body: I'm a bit concerned this is going to actively discourage people from keeping the CHANGELOG up-to-date.
That's the wrong CHANGELOG, so no one should be keeping it up to date.
Whether this is a deprecated changelog or not, if it were in use `@digital-asset/approvers` means anyone who has write access can approve it. What would you propose @garyverhaegen-da?

There was no description of what "approvers" mean. If it means everyone, I have no objection.

@neil-da if it's the wrong file, should it be deleted?
No, it's handy because it points people at the actual changelog.

@garyverhaegen-da from the email: "Add a @digital-asset/daml-approvers team for everyone who should be able to approve things. I recommend this starts with all code-contributors in the DAML Language, DAML Runtime, and DAML-on-X teams. Other employees can also be added on a case-by-case basis."

diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+# https://help.github.com/articles/about-codeowners/
+# Note that GitHub teams must have WRITE access to the repository.
+
+# Default owners for everything in the repo unless a later match takes
+# precedence.
+*           @digital-asset/daml-owners
+CODEOWNERS  @digital-asset/daml-owners # Only owners can change this file
+
+VERSION     @digital-asset/daml-approvers # Any approver can approve a release
+
+# Build / CI / environment
+/3rdparty/          @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/bazel_tools/       @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/build-scripts/     @digital-asset/infrastructure
+/ci/                @digital-asset/infrastructure

+BAZEL.md            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+BUILD               @digital-asset/infrastructure

+build.Jenkinsfile   @digital-asset/infrastructure
+build.ps1           @digital-asset/infrastructure
+build.sh            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+deps.bzl            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+dotfiles            @digital-asset/infrastructure
+
+# Language
+/compiler/          @digital-asset/language
+/daml-foundations/  @digital-asset/language
+/libs-haskell/      @digital-asset/language
+/ghc-lib/           @digital-asset/language
+
+# SDK
+/release/           @digital-asset/language @digital-asset/infrastructure

+
+CHANGELOG           @digital-asset/approvers
